00140     public function Start ( )
00141     // User's manual :
00142     //Start the application
00143         //Call the call back function set up by OnApplicationStart
00144         //
00145         // Returns :
00146         //- null if application successfully started
00147         //- an object of type Errors in case of error(s)
00148         //
00149     // Contract :
00150     //
00151         {
00152                 if ( $this->started )
00153                 {
00154                         $errors = new Errors ();
00155                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::ALREADY_STARTED, 'Application has been already started.' ) );
00156                         
00157                         return $errors;
00158                 }
00159         
00160                 // get launchTime in microseconds
00161                 $this->systemVars[ self::SYSTEM_START_TIME ] = microtime ( true );
00162                 
00163                 // set up call back function for the end of the application
00164                 register_shutdown_function ( $this->onApplicationEnd, $this->systemVars );
00165 
00166                 return $this->launchCallBack ( 'onApplicationStart' );
00167         } // End of Start
00168         
00169     public function OnApplicationStart ( $function, $params )
00170     // User's manual :
00171     //Set up call_back function for Application Start.
00172         //The $function will be called when Start() will
00173         //
00174         //$function is the name of the function to be called
00175         //$params must be an array of parameters for the function
00176         //
00177         //For calling method of a class, use array (& $obj, 'method_name')
00178         //
00179         // Returns :
00180         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00181         //- null instead
00182         //
00183         //
00184         // Errors may be composed by :
00185         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00186         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY;
00187         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS;
00188         //
00189     // Contract :
00190     //
00191         {
00192                 return $this->setCallBack ( 'onApplicationStart', $function, $params ) ;
00193         }
00194         
00195     public function OnApplicationEnd ( $function )
00196     // User's manual :
00197     //Set up call_back function for Application End.
00198         //The $function will be called when Script will be stopped
00199         //
00200         //$function is the name of the function to be called
00201         //$function may accept 1 argument. This argument will be an array of system variables
00202         //Please look at the definition of systemVars
00203         //
00204         //For calling method of a class, use array (& $obj, 'method_name')
00205         //
00206         // Returns :
00207         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00208         //- null instead
00209         //
00210         //
00211         // Errors may be composed by :
00212         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00213         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY;
00214         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS;
00215         //
00216     // Contract :
00217     //
00218         {
00219                 $falseArray = array();
00220                         $errors = $this->setCallBack ( 'onApplicationEnd', $function, $falseArray ) ;
00221                 unset( $falseArray );
00222                 
00223                 if ( $errors InstanceOf Errors )
00224                 {
00225                         return $errors;
00226                 }
00227 
00228                 return null;
00229         }

00232     protected function __construct()
00233     // User's manual :
00234     //Internal constructor that disable instanciation
00235     // Contract :
00236     //
00237     {
00238                 $this->configuration = new Variables ( new BDDRecordSet() );
00239                 $this->started = false;
00240                 
00241                 $this->systemVars = array( );
00242         
00243                 $this->onApplicationStart = -1;
00244                 $this->onApplicationStartParams = -1;
00245                 
00246                 $this->onApplicationEnd = -1;
00247                 $this->onApplicationEndParams = -1;
00248                 
00249                 $this->var_globals = & $GLOBALS;
00250                 $this->var_post = & $_POST;
00251                 $this->var_get = & $_GET;
00252                 $this->var_files = & $_FILES;
00253         
00254     } //---- End of __construct

00278 //------------------------------------------------------ protected methods
00279     // protected type Méthode ( );
00280     // User's manual :
00281     //
00282     // Contract :
00283     //
00284         
00285         protected function isCorrectCallBack ( & $function, & $params, Errors $errors )
00286         // User's manual :
00287         //Let us know if a $function and it's $params are good to form a 
00288         //call back function
00289         //
00290         // Returns :
00291         //- true if the function can be set as CallBack
00292         //- false instead
00293         //
00294         // Contract :
00295         //$errors must be not null
00296         {       
00297                 // function incorrect or doesn't have good scope
00298                 if ( !is_callable( $function ) )
00299                 {
00300                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE, 'Incorrect function or scope.') );
00301                 }
00302                 
00303                 // params not an array
00304                 if ( !is_array( $params ) )
00305                 {
00306                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY, 'Params of the function must be an array.') );                
00307                 }
00308                 
00309                 return ( $errors->GetCount () == 0 );
00310         } // End of isCorrectCallBack
00311         
00312         protected function setCallBack ( $callBackName, & $function, & $params )
00313         // User's manual :
00314         //Let us know if a $function and its $params are good to form a 
00315         //call back function
00316         //
00317         // Returns :
00318         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00319         //- null instead
00320         //
00321         //
00322         // Errors may be composed by :
00323         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00324         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY
00325         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS
00326         //
00327         // Contract :
00328         //
00329         {                       
00330                 $errors = new Errors();
00331                 
00332                 if ( $this->isCorrectCallBack( $function , $params, $errors ) === false )
00333                 // if we had some errors
00334                 {
00335                         return $errors;
00336                 }
00337 
00338                 if ( ! IsSet ( $this->{$callBackName} ) || ! IsSet ( $this->{$callBackName.'Params'} ) )
00339                 {
00340                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS, 'You tried to set up a callback that doesn\'t exists.') );
00341                         
00342                         return $errors;
00343                 }
00344                 
00345                 // association
00346                 $this->{$callBackName} = $function;
00347                 $this->{$callBackName.'Params'} = $params;
00348                 
00349                 unset ( $errors );
00350                 
00351                 return null;
00352         } // End of setCallBack
00353         
00354         protected function launchCallBack ( $callBackName )
00355         // User's manual :
00356         //Launch CallBack function that names $callBackName
00357         //
00358         // Returns :
00359         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00360         //- null instead
00361         //
00362         //
00363         // Errors may be composed by :
00364         //
00365         // Contract :
00366         //
00367         {
00368                 // launch start call_back function if set
00369                 if ( @$this->{ $callBackName } !== -1 )
00370                 {
00371                         call_user_func_array ( $this->{ $callBackName }, $this->{ $callBackName.'Params' } );
00372                         
00373                         return null;
00374                 }
00375                 else
00376                 {
00377                         $errors = new Errors();
00378                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_SET, 'You are trying to launch an unset callback function.') );
00379                         
00380                         return $errors;
00381                 }
00382         } // End of launchCallBack
00383

00405         protected $configuration;
